title: Taree Wildcats host zone championships at Omaru Park | Manning River Times
body_text:
TAREE Wildcats finish the 2024 Football Mid North Coast season this weekend when hosting the zone championships at Omaru Park.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
This will feature games between the zone's northern and southern premiers in the various divisions to decide the overall champions.
Under 18s and women's matches will be played on Friday night with the rest on Saturday.
"From Friday to Sunday we expect close to 2000 people to utilise Omaru Park - it will be huge," Taree Wildcats secretary Michael Wallace said.
The Wildcats had a mixed day at the Football Mid North Coast Southern League grand final day at South Street Tuncurry.
Taree was represented in four of the six matches and came away with two wins and two close losses.
In the first game of the day, the Wildcats 15s team scored a convincing 3-0 win against Old Bar
Wallace said it is a credit to the team and coaches Ben Randle and Michael De Wright.
"Three years ago when Ben and Michael started coaching this team they were last on the ladder. Through their consistent efforts this team had become the top team with an almost unblemished season (one loss only),'' he said.
Wildcats Jaguars 13s, coached by Adam Johnson, also had a comfortable win against Hallidays Point 3-1. This team also only lost one game this year and on grand final day showed their attacking power to go to a 3-0 lead before conceding late when the game was over.
Wildcats Jaguars 16s, coached by Graeme Budden, were the most improved team in their age group. They went down to Hallidays Point 1-0 in the grand final. This was after losing to the same team in penalties in the major semi final two weeks before.
The team showed great determination, with an own goal unfortunately being the difference.
Wallace said that overall it has been a great year for the club.
"The improvement we have shown over the past five years has been enormous,'' he said.
"In my 17 years with the club, there has never been a time we have been in four grand finals in one year. Our plans are working."
